text: Binary Search works only on sorted arrays and reduces the search space by half each step.
Binary Search has time complexity O(log n) because the array is divided into two halves every step.
Two pointers technique is useful when scanning arrays or strings from both ends efficiently.
Always define a base case in recursion to avoid infinite recursive calls.
Dynamic Programming stores results of overlapping subproblems to avoid recomputation.
DNS translates human-readable domain names like google.com into IP addresses required for routing.
DNS lookup happens before any HTTP request so the browser knows which server to contact.
HTTP is a request-response protocol used by browsers and servers to transfer web pages.
In HTTP, the client sends a request and the server replies with a response containing status codes and data.
HTTPS is HTTP with encryption using TLS to protect data like passwords and card details.
TCP establishes connection using three-way handshake: SYN, SYN-ACK, and ACK.
TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery using acknowledgements and retransmissions.
UDP is connectionless and does not guarantee delivery, order, or duplication protection.
UDP is used in video streaming and online gaming where speed is more important than reliability.
A process is an independent program in execution with its own memory space.
A thread is the smallest unit of CPU execution and shares memory with other threads of the same process.
Deadlock occurs when processes wait indefinitely for resources held by each other.
Indexes improve read performance by allowing faster search but slow down write operations.
Encapsulation hides internal data and exposes only necessary functionality through methods.
